alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hamilton; Jackson; Jefferson; Perry; Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:20AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Perry, northwestern White, southwestern Wayne, Jefferson, northern Jackson, Hamilton and Franklin Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 519 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Helm to 6 miles southwest of Ashley to near Red Bud. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bluford and Tamaroa around 530 AM CDT. Wayne City around 535 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Sesser, Christopher, Rend Lake Area, Valier, Benton, West City, Willisville, West Frankfort, Ava, Enfield and Thompsonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 63 and 105. Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 63 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for south central, southern and southeastern Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Hamilton; Jackson; Jefferson; Perry; Wayne; White
